title: 114_s1995
content: The Act is titled the "Outdoor Recreation Legacy Partnership Grant Program Act of 2015." It includes definitions for various terms used in the Act. The Act defines an "eligible entity" as a State, political subdivision, special purpose district, or Indian tribe. Political subdivisions and Indian tribes must represent or serve a specific area to be considered eligible. The Outdoor Recreation Legacy Partnership Grant Program is established for qualifying urban areas as defined by the Bureau of the Census. The Secretary of the Interior oversees this program. The Secretary will establish a grant program for outdoor recreation projects, including land acquisition and facility development. Eligible entities must provide matching funds equal to 100% of the grant amount from various sources. Eligible uses for the grants will be determined. Grant recipients can use funds to acquire land or water for outdoor recreation and develop facilities prioritizing projects that enhance access in urban areas, engage underserved communities and youth, provide job opportunities, establish public-private partnerships, and coordinate with government levels. Grant recipients are restricted from using grant funds for grant administration costs, incidental costs related to land acquisition, operation and maintenance activities, facilities supporting professional athletics, indoor facilities, or land acquisition that restricts access to specific persons. SEC. 5. NATIONAL PARK SERVICE REQUIREMENTS. The Secretary will screen and review grant applications and evaluate them. SEC. 6. REPORTING. SEC. 6. REPORTING. State lead agencies must submit annual performance and financial reports summarizing project activities and status. Final reports are due within 90 days of project completion. SEC. 7. REVENUE SHARING. SEC. 7. REVENUE SHARING. Amends the Gulf of Mexico Energy Security Act to allocate 20 percent of revenue for grants under the Outdoor Recreation Legacy Partnership Grant Program Act of 2015 from fiscal years 2017 to 2055.
